Package ji.common.functions

Class Mapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • ji.common.functions.Mapper
  • public class Mapper
extends java.lang.Object
    Class is able to convert data class (entity) to Map (serialize) and Map back to entity (parse).

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static Mapper get()
        Returns new instance of Mapper
        Returns:
        Mapper

      • serialize

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> serialize​(java.lang.Object value)
        Serialize data class to Map During serialization JI come thru all fields of entity and uses then as key in new Map. Values of fields become values. Serializations works recursivelly.

        If you wish ignore field during serialization, just add MapperIgnored annotation.

        The null field value will not be serialized if ignoreOnNull is set.

        If you do not wish use field name as key, you need to annotate this field with MapperParameter and as value to put MapperType.

        Parameters:
        value - Object what will be serialized
        Returns:
        Map serialized object

      • serialize

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> serialize​(java.lang.Object value,
                                                                        java.lang.String key)
        Serialize data class to Map One entity can be serialized in more ways that are defined by string key.

        MapperIgnored contains array of strings. If one of then is equals to given key, field will be ignored. If the array is empty (default state), field will be always ignored. Otherwise will be used.

        MapperParameter can has more than one MapperType. MapperType has key parameter that specified the 'way'. Default is empty string and means 'use if no others options'. For more details see serialize(Object)

        Parameters:
        value - Object what will be serialized
        key - String use case identifier
        Returns:
        Map serialized object

      • parse

        public <T> T parse​(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                   java.lang.Object source)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Parse Map to given data object Parsing is reverse of serialize. From Map create entity (Or from list of map, result will be list of entity). During serialization JI come thru all fields of entity and try finds for it value in Map. As key is used field name. Parsing works recursively.

        If you do not wish use field name as key, you need to annotate this field with MapperParameter and as value to put MapperType.

        LocalTime, LocalDate, LocalDateTime and ZonedDateTime is parsed from string using standart java formats. If datetime string is in different format, use dateTimeFormat attribute of MapperType.

        Type Parameters:
        T - data object class
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class final data object class
        source - Map or Collection source data to parse
        Returns:
        new instance of given class
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • parse

        public <T> T parse​(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                   java.lang.Object source,
                   java.lang.String key)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Parse Map to given data object

        One entity can be parsed in more ways that are defined by string key. This key is the second (optional) parameter to parse method. MapperParameter can has more than one MapperType. MapperType has key parameter that specified the 'way'. Default is empty string and means 'use if no others options'.

        For more details see parse(Class, Object)

        Type Parameters:
        T - data object class
        Parameters:
        clazz - Class final data object class
        source - Map or Collection source data to parse
        key -
        Returns:
        new instance of given class
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
